reviewText: Another good video from Hemalayaa.  It can be a little rough on your knees, but other than that I think it's great!

Hello There...  This is only one of Her workout DVDs that I own and I must say they are ALL great fun (and a good workout too!!!) My niece and My Mom (Grandma) and I all work out at the same time and have a wonderful time doing it.  Doesn't seem like work at all!!!~!  BUT you feel it later.  If you want a good workout for all ages and you want to have a fun time in the process...try Hemalayaa's workouts!!  Absolutely OUTSTANDING!!!
I love this workout. It's not only fun but sexy too. Ladies, you will get a sense of your self and your body like never before.  Hemalayaa is great!
I am so excited Hemalayaa has a new DVD - I love her other DVDs and this one is just as fun.  I laugh while working out and next thing I know the workout is over and I feel great.

Hema's programs are all about having fun while exercising.  The first time I did this workout I had no idea that 45 minutes had passed, I was too busy having a blast doing all the creative moves and shaking my booty!!!!

I really expected this to be a fun video, I love bollywood music but I could hardly hear it b/c of the voice over which was so annoying, it didn't coordinate with her voice and the moves, the timing was off and I got frustrated. If she just spoke while exercising it would have been much better and used better music.
It is a fun work out, however if you are a beginner to it can be abit overwhelming. Otherwise a fun and enjoyable workout!
These was a very fun workout. She moves a lot and prepares you for the moves. The music was good and she has a lot of energy.

I just saw Hemalayaa on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show" and she had everybody up dancing and laughing! I loved her BOLLYWOOD DANCE WORKOUT and BOLLYWOOD BURN so I can't wait to try BOLLYWOOD BOOTY. Moves like "feed the chickens" and "screw in the lightbulb" are such a hoot that I barely know I'm exercising...
Fun Workout! Keeps you moving but still low impact (for the most part).
Not for people with bad knees.
So much fun, and a real workout too! I want more of her videos!

This is a great video. I have a ton of workout videos- mostly Jillian michaels kathy kaehler etc but wanted to try something new. I will first say "I cannot dance" its true I am impossible but this was very easy to do and lots of fun and the direction, music, and actors are great. not irritating just fun and freeing. I tried zumba but quit because the moves are too specific and I couldn't do them. but this was great. Im going to order more of the videos from her collection. And I was quite sore for the first 3 times after doing this so it does actually work, just muscles that other workouts don't traditionally focus on. The only reason I didn't give it 5 is because they do tend to focus on one movement for an extended period of time. They change it up with speed and arm movements though.

By far the most fun, great excercise, meditative with movement, sensual, exotic, instructional dance video I have ever done! I try different dance videos frequently, and this is the most fun I have ever had while simultaneiously getting a great workout, and sweat. I love how this dance is a sensual meditation in motion for the feminine energy. The last part is incredible!!!
OK HEMAILAYAA  IS A HOTTIE  COFFEE IN THE MORNING WHILE LEARNING SOMETHING  LOL  OK  I JUST LIKE WATCHING HER MOVES !!
I love this DVD! Current favorite work out DVD. I can do as much or as little as I have time for each morning before work, the menu is set up to select segments. Not to mention it is FUN!!!!
So much fun! and was easy to follow along and learn the moves-- Would definitely recommend this to my friends!
She makes working out fun. An hour goes by and it doesn't even feel like it. A must buy for those who are tired of those boring plank and crunch work outs!

Rating is five stars, It could not be any less.  Yes, I am a male and I heard a lot from my female friends, sisters, and female coworkers about not having enough time to work out, its boring, takes away from the family, and ect. This DVD is in complete English.  I am going to put this in my face book page.  I have also ordered 7 DVDs for my female relatives, friends, coworkers, sister-n-law, and ex-wife.  So do I think highly of this?  You will hear words like Boo-tay walk, Swan, Tick-tock, Hip flick, and Over the shoulder.  This is more than exercise for the complete body.  It is the teaching of being Sensual....  Years ago, my ex  took lessons on belly dancing.  Then she was too embarrassing to show me. It seem to me ( a man) that American women/girls are embarrassed to show sensually unless it has to do with sex.  It is another way of dancing, flirting, and expressing oneself.  So I am giving copies of this DVD to my people. The ages are 20 to over 60.  Friends, this is for your health, your sensually, and your love life (husband or other person).

Hemalayaa has a great booty, and thighs exercises in this video. There is a warm up and then three workouts. In the first two workouts you learn different moves. In the last workout you combine all the moves you just learned. This workout is so fun, and you feel sexy when you move you hips like this!!! After the workouts there is a cool down. I think her workouts are awesome, and I like that she is so energetic, expressive and smiley!! "laugh, smile, enjoy yourself"!!!
I absolutely love this workout.  If you love dancing but hate the thought of exercise this is the video for you. Simply put, Its Fun!

Her dance workouts are a blast to do. Even when I don't want to exercise, I find myself laughing and enjoying myself not 10 mins in. This one in particular is not as hard as some of the others, in so that I mean I don't get winded and sweaty half as much. I use it for days when I'm not feeling like bouncing around too much.

For me, I don't feel "booty" in particular with most of these moves, but my butt has never been my area of focus, so I don't mind if it's not targeting it. I use it as a gentler, lower body work out.

This is a good workout but it is not what i expected. I wanted to work out to the songs I know from Bollywood but instead you just hear her annoying voice for the most part. STILL I FELT IT IN MY THIGHS!!!!!!

I'll start by saying that I don't really like working out. It's just a habit that I do every day. With that said I found myself smiling and even laughing when I did this workout for the first time. It's enough of a workout to get you sweating and works a lot of muscle groups, but it really is just so much fun!
Saw on TV she was very good and my daughter and I were having so much fun dancing along I had to order..

I'll say at the outset that I am not thrilled with this DVD, but your mileage may vary. It all depends on what you're looking for in a workout DVD.

First, some general comments on the production value. The camera angle changes frequently, sometimes as often as every few seconds. This is distracting and sometimes you can't even see what you need to see as far as the demonstration goes. For example, in one segment, you reach your arm over your head with your hand in a mudra (hand position). However, you do 5-6 reaches before you even see what the hand movement is.

One way to overcome this problem is to watch the DVD in its entirety before attempting to do the exercises contained therein. Then you'd know what to expect.

The music is on an endless loop, which is somewhat annoying. The other reviewers suggest that Hemalayaa is off-beat. I don't notice this, but I have no rhythm and no dance background. So if you are like me, this won't bother you. If you have some dance experience, however, your opinion will likely differ.

I think the set is nice (appropriate for the type of dance and not too cluttered) although the lighting is a bit dark. The women behind Hemalayaa are mostly able to keep up and seem to know what they're doing.

As a workout video, what this DVD lacks is cueing. Hemalayaa's commentary is excessive (instead of just telling you what the moves are, she adds a lot of chatter) and she's doing more describing of the action than telling you what's next. It's almost as if she's watching it for the first time, herself. It doesn't give a feel of being choreographed, which is not a good thing in a dance workout.

This DVD has six main segments, a warm-up, four "workouts," and a cool-down.

The warm-up is short -- only about four minutes. You do a lot of arm movements that you will need to remember later and, to be fair, you do move the entire body.

Workout 1 is about five and a half minutes. It involves a lot of plies, some with toe taps or kicks, and a variety of upper arm movements. There's also some walking in place. This one is fun, actually, but too short to properly be called a "workout."

Workout 2 is eight minutes long. You use the arm movements from the warmup a lot. There are some lunges and hops here. You should watch out for these -- there's no instruction as to how to safely perform these moves. In the lunges, Hemalayaa's knees go way out over her toes, which most other workout DVDs recommend against doing. And the hops are high-impact. She tells you not to do the hops if it's hard on your knees, but doesn't offer an alternative move. This segment also has some hip lifts and shimmies.

Workout 3 is about twelve and a half minutes long. It consists almost entirely of moving your hips in a figure 8 and hip flicks/lifts. The last 2-3 minutes of this one have some additional moves.

Workout 4 is about eleven and a half minutes long. This is a collection of moves from the other segments and doesn't contain anything new. While I could've dealt with the amount of repetition in the other segments, this one really drove home just how much repetition this DVD contained.

The cool-down is only about three and a half minutes (the rest of this track on the DVD consists of the credits). It's a pretty standard Hemalayaa cool down, with lots of forward bends and slow, flowing movements. There's one part where you squat deeply, with your rear end almost to the floor and your knees sharply bent. Be careful with this part, as it could be brutal if you have bad knees. I have to back off in this segment.

You are not going to get much benefit from only doing one or two of the workouts and nothing else. Even doing the whole DVD may not be enough to break a sweat if you're an intermediate or advanced exerciser. One thing that could be useful is doing a segment or two of this as a warm-up before lower body strength training, just for something different.

There are a few good things about this DVD. It's fairly fun, and you don't need a lot of room. You don't need to be super-coordinated and, with the amount of repetition, you'll have the moves down by the end (there aren't any complicated combinations). It won't teach you to be a dancer, but it will get you moving. Hemalayaa is enthusiastic and seems to genuinely be enjoying herself.

In the end, what you'll get out of this depends on what you're looking for. If you just want something fun to do a couple of times a month to change up your routine, or if you want to use part of this as a warm-up for strength training, it may be worth a purchase. If you're already a dancer or are serious about dropping some weight, you may want to look elsewhere.

Hemalaya is perky and cute,
But this didn't really work my glutes,
It made my achy knees and back scream,
Not exactly my workout dream,

This DVD is well-made and easy to follow,
However the workout promises are hollow,
You will sweat a little and learn a few moves,
I like how Hemalaya grooves,

I wish she'd make a routine,
Of dance moves that would make me look good in jeans,
Bollywood with some booty moves too,
That is what I ask of you.

I just tried this for the first time this morning.  I did the warm up, the first 2 workouts and the cool down.  What FUN!!!  The music was fun and the moves were a blast!  I like the way Hemalayaa uses visualization and makes everything a positive, fun experience.  She encourages you to feel sensual in the movements, which is kind of a giggle for me as a mother of 5, but it's a great workout.  I did it 12 hours ago, and my thighs are still burning!  I am also a big fan of Bollywood Boogie.  I also bought Bollywood Burn, but I haven't tried it yet.  LOVE HER!

Fun moves, good music.  You can follow along or improv.  Move the same or at your own pace.  Some moves are similar to the hula.  You will want to keep your feet on the ground during the brief jumping moves if you are older or if you have knee issues.
Slow rhythm & music isn't enjoyable while working out. Her voice is annoying as she instructs dance moves. The settings look old & not up to date.
This is a great exercise video. It is easy to follow and low impact on the back and knees. I skip the jumping parts sometimes.

First of all, I LOVE this dvd ! I'm 30 and a pretty active person; I do a lot of zumba and workout classes and I can't attend those classes, I love doing workout dvds. I'm pretty used to Jillian Michaels 30 day shred and Ripped in 30 type of dvds and I wanted to try something more fun for days when I just wanted to shake my booty.
This dvd is a lot of fun and brings a lot of happiness. I know people have a hard time with the voice over but it didn't bother me at all since the instructor always has a nice smile on her face and is very expressive with her movements. I love the fact that the moves have a meaning to them, like "paint the walls with love" and then "paint yourselves with the same kindness". It is not only a focus on fitness and building muscles and strength but it is also about feel good and sexy ! Some hip movements can be a bit challenging but I felt like the workout helped me loosen my spine. I also love the sassiness about it !

I really recommend if you don't necessarily have a crazy hardcore workout but if you want to sweat, smile and feel happy and sexy :D Have fun ! Namaste

Pros:
* Great for beginners or people (like me) who need extra toning and aren't in their best shape (gets some great firmness on the thighs and butt)
* Doesn't require a large space to do
* Simple, fairly easy to follow routine - if you aren't used to learning dance/exercise routine it might take a few tries
* Moves have names that will make you smile, and the instructor encourages you to laugh at them
* Upbeat, although slightly hyper sounding, instructor (seriously she sounds like she just downed 8 shots of espresso)
* Right from the beginning it states it is designed for ALL body types, sizes and is meant to enhance a woman's assets. So firm and enhance the rear bumper, wittle the waist. Perfect.
* Music is nice, not the best, but good.

Cons:
* While it does have a Bollywood flavor, it really isn't as Bollywood oriented as I would have liked. I love bollywood dancing, and this may be inspired by it, but it isn't going ot teach you moves you've seen in films. However, since it is a beginner level workout that isn't really surprising.
* Maybe it is just after getting used to everything in HD, but it isn't the most crisp image.

Overall, I give 5 stars. I was looking for easy for getting back in shape and something that makes me smile while I sweat. Honestly, I loved it as soon as they talked about embracing your body type and enhancing what you have.
I did these workouts on demand when we had cable, and loved them. I looked forward to workouts. I did this one and the dance workouts. These are my favorite workouts.

Ladies, if you are looking for a workout that's fun and a bit different and makes you smile while you sweat then you must give this one a go! I have been doing 3 routines plus the warmup 2-3 times a week and by the time I am finished am totally drenched in sweat.  I bought a belly dancing hip scarf on eBay for aud$10 which i wear over exercise pants and a crop top so I jingle to the moves as well which helps me move my booty more.
Hemalayaa is an amazing instructor, I've seen many fitness DVDs and for me what helps me chose one is if I like the instructor and the way she teaches and after seeing the previews on YouTube I couldn't wait to give it a go and I was not disappointed. I'm quite uncoordinated but once you do the routines a few times you get used to moving different parts of your body at the same time. I was surprised with myself because I never even had to stop and rewind any of it on my first go so that was a giant plus. The music is cool too so that helps. The hopping is very minimal, I have knee problems so I just don't do the hopping and my knees are fine with everything else. The swan is very sensual and the elk move is hot and I agree that bollywood vogue has to be done with the funny face.
Hemalayaa was once on Ellen so check that one out on you tube.
Have fun and play with bollywood booty!

I saw a trailer and thought hey, I can do this.  Well I can and have and really love it.  I had purchased a bellydance scarf for my Zumba workout and use it w/this so I can hear by booty shaking. It is so much fun that it must be illegal!! I will eventually get all of her video collection.  I like having fun when I workout and I add weights to make it more intense(hand and ankle types)  I just love the fun part, because if I am not having fun I will not do it!!

I have many of the Hemalayaa videos, and while I love them all, this is one of my favorites.  It is a fun workout, and I can feel the difference in my legs after exercising with the video.  My other favorite is "Bollywood Dance Workout." These two videos are the best, although, I would recommend any of Hemalayaa's workout videos.  She is a great motivator, and the workouts are always exciting and enjoyable.
Like another reviewer, I have this in both DVD and instant video and have no problem with the beat matching the moves.  This is fun and is enough of a workout to create a "glow".

Hemalayaa provides a warm-up that's pretty effective. The warm-up alone is worth having. I like that it's low-impact so that most people can do it. I do think certain sections of the workout would strengthen your thighs and your rear end. But Hemalayaa incorporates some high-impact exercises that seem more geared for cardio than for shaping your muscles.

Sometimes her voice-overs are annoying, such as "Paint yourself ... infuse yourself with love." I prefer it when she just gives cues and encouragement. I don't need to hear, "All your cells are getting excited."

For the most part, the music is motivating. The set is appropriate -- not too cluttered, but interesting.

I liked that Hemalayaa incorporated some bellydance moves like the figure 8 and snake arms. Of course, she puts her own style on them. If you're going to get one of her Bollywood excercise workouts, I'd get this one instead of "The Bollywood Dance Workout." This one is far less silly and much more graceful.

I'm not sure why the entire sequence of exercises was repeated. I would have preferred to have some different moves included instead. I wouldn't say that this is really four separate workouts. I'm not sure why it's marketed that way.

But I really do like Hemalayaa as an instructor. I guess I'd just like to see her teaching a different kind of workout -- more structured and totally low-impact.

Special features: There is a bonus classical Indian dance with Hemalayaa that's really more of a stretch. It might be good for getting your muscles to relax. Like yoga, it has some exercise benefits. But a lot of the symbolism is annoying. Everything seems to be a goddess pose or an acknowledgment to "mother earth." I guess I just prefer the professional exercise approach to the pagan imagery.

Then there is the extra free-for-all "Liberation" dance with some other instructor which consists of a bunch of people just bopping around like monkeys. It's more like a meaningless music video than a workout. The voice-overs are silly and obnoxious ... "dancing for no reason at all." Yeah. I guess so. Who'd have a reason to dance like that? It's not even dance.

The third extra is a Brazilian workout that is fairly high impact. It seems like it would be pretty fun on days when you have a lot of energy. You'll have to ignore the third performer, however, because he really doesn't fit in with his dreadlocks. I guess the makers of the video wanted to indicate that men could do the workout, too. Maybe they thought the wild look was better than the athletic look, but I don't agree. This is, after all, an exercise workout.

Most likely I will want to just stick with the workouts by Hemalayaa. The last two special features are really previews of other DVDs. I'd be interested in the Brazilian one if the third performer didn't look so silly. But the "Liberation" one is worthless. If I want to dance freely, I'll do it. I don't need a DVD full of obnoxious chatter and people flopping around to do it. At least you don't pay for it, because it's just an extra. And you can skip it if you want. (I would.)

I detest exercising.  It is my least favorite thing to do, but since I want to be healthy I drag myself through work outs anyway.  But this is fun!  From the hip popping to the Bollywood posing, every minute is a joy.  I'm sweating my butt off and still smiling!  Amazing.

All the dance moves are explained well, and you are given plenty of time to learn the next step.  You definitely feel it in your hips, lower abs, butt, and legs as you follow along. This is my favorite addition to my at home workout routine.

I normally do yoga but I wanted somthing I could do with my kids. I'm a stay at home mom, and I thought this would be fun with two two-year olds running around me. They try to do it with me and I can get a great cardio workout. It's alot of fun and you don't feel like your exercising.

I own several of Hemalayaa's dvds and this one is my favorite so far. The music is great and the workout is fun. I also use the Zumba workout with my Wii player which is a good cardio program but, after doing the Bollywood Booty routine, I really feel it in the glutes, thighs and calves. I love the fact that I can do her routines in bare feet. She is very pleasant to follow and has an uplifting spirit that projects thru the TV screen. All of her dvds including this one are broken up into several short sessions so you can pick and choose the ones you like or do them all together for a great cardio and toning workout. I will definitely buy more of her dvds as new ones come out, she actually makes me WANT to workout everyday!

On preview, I was not overly enthused with this workout but after finally giving it a try I found it was a lot of fun. Good for light/recovery days, you get about 40 minutes of continuous movement, enough that my headband was soaked when it was through. The pace is doable and the steps are very easy, though if you are uncoordinated like me, it might be a good idea to start with a belly dance basics DVD so that you can learn some of the movements as there are no actual "how-to" dance instructions. The sections are rather repetitive but for me that's a plus because I really need to work on my figure eights and hip bumps. (To be honest, I need to work on everything!) Hemalayaa has a stunning but approachable beauty and a warm deep voice--a joy to listen to even if her cues are not always where they need to be. She's a pleasant and encouraging instructor who makes the workout inviting, I'll be buying more of her DVDs.

I ordered this workout thinking I would enjoy some fun moves to cool bollywood music.  It was such a major disappointment.  The biggest issue is she is not even on the beat with her moves.  For anyone with any dance or music experience at all it completely fries the nervous system to have someone leading moves OFF the beat.  Either she has no skill in this, or the music is dubbed over the video and the editor really screwed up.  The moves are boring and it isn't much of a workout...that is if you can even get past the first couple songs without throwing something at your TV.
I really like this workout, it keeps you interested and moving.  The steps are easy to follow.  I did a half hour and I was sweating like crazy.
Trying to get my dvd player working. Sure it'll be great to work out to.

I really liked the IDEA of this video, but like some of the other viewers said, there was a lot of repetition.  Some of the movements are fun, but that didn't make up for feeling like you weren't really getting a workout.  I'm not into super intense workouts, and even really like the idea of working out in bare feet, but it was way too easy.  Also, most of the repetitive movements involve light bending of the knees over and over.  I felt like it wasn't very good for my knees because they kept popping and making noise while doing the movements.  If you are looking for a fun, very light cardio workout then I would recommend it but not to target the buns or work up a sweat.
Don't think about it, just purchase this video.  You will have so much fun and it is a great workout.

I really like this DVD because I'm dancing & working out all at the same time. I've been really working up a sweat with it.  Great Cardio.  I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to create a fun work out for themselves.

I wanted to like this video, but I can't say I do.

Hemalayaa does all right in terms of enthusiasm. But she misrepresents some of the work that goes into "hip flicks," saying the movement comes from the hip.  It doesn't.  It comes from the knees and abs.  I have a problem with her bouncing movements as well. Only in this video does she acknowledge that hops can hurt a person's knees. The bouncing stretches, which she also uses on "Beautiful Belly," can cause injury. (So don't bounce, stretch. No workout should hurt you.)

I have a hard time with her diction, too. I guess it's because I'm from a different generation, but I really do prefer hearing the correct terms (e.g., gluteus or glutes) rather than slang. I knew to expect the word "booty," but "Butt Monster Moves"?  A little too crass for me.

I find the editing something of a problem because the cut-aways mess up what there is of a count system and when they come back to the dancers' actions, the dancers aren't moving in the correct direction. Sometimes even Hemalayaa is moving in the wrong direction. Oh, and Hemalayaa gets her left and right mixed up at times. Since she did a voice over, you'd think they would have fixed the problem. Or maybe they didn't notice. (Acacia People: next time try the workout a few times before you print the DVD!)

Speaking of counts, they seem slapdash. I've counted out the movements. Sometimes Hemalayaa starts a new movement on 7 and others at 8. There are instances of 6 count steps, which occur with some predictability once you know what to expect, but she doesn't say so.  Even her own back up dancers seem to be confused every once in a while.

The warm up is too short, warming up nothing at all and the routine itself is boring. It feels as if she just threw it together on a whim. That said, it gets the job done.

What do I like?  Well, I do appreciate Hemalayaa's beauty and physique. I appreciate her enthusiasm. I think that maybe her yoga practice might be more inspiring, and I'd like to see her teaching traditional Indian dance, since her short dance presentation was lovely. I wish she'd talk a little more about the meaning of the mudra she used in the workout--because different mudras do have different meanings. It would only take a few seconds.
Really enjoy working out to this video. It's fun but you still feel you got a good workout at the end. No complicated dance steps. Music is good. Not that high intensity dance club stuff!

As someone who works out normally 5-6 days a week, now that Im in my first trimister I don't always feel like goin to the gym and have found myself a little tired lately. However this tape is so fun, time goes by fast, and I feel that this DVD works my glutes. A good tape to have to add varity.

I know that probably makes me sound like a spambot, but I'm not kidding.  This DVD was an impulse buy at a store, and it was so much fun that I have bought a whole slew of dance workout DVDs here since.  I had hit a plateau in my weight loss before I started doing this workout, and I lost 20 pounds--a conservative estimate--after I started to do this workout everyday.  (I was rather heavy, so if you weigh 140 pounds, don't blame me if you don't lose as much.)

This is the best of the Acacia Bollywood series that I've tried, which are the Bollywood Dance Workout and Beautiful Belly.  I haven't tried Bollywood Burn.  The others are too hard on my knees, but there is little hopping around in this one.  It still gets your heart rate going, and it is easy to do in a small space.  I highly recommend it!

I also adore the bonus Odissi dance piece, and I wish I could get my hands on more of that.

I was a little nervous about buying this video because I truly did not think I would get a good workout. I was obviously wrong. This is one of the best videos I've ever purchased. I didn't expect a hardcore workout and that's not what you get. What you get is a fun, sexy video that makes you sweat and feel great. The video flies by so fast I just want to do it over and over again. Definetly a good purchase for someone who wants to dance to lose weight.

I haven't had much luck with workout dvds in the past but I look forward to trying to master these workouts so I can be as graceful as Hemalayaa. Sometimes she does move a little fast but she always makes sure to mention that you should go at your own pace. I also like the fact she is very conscientious of people with knee problems (I don't have any though) and makes sure to announce with certain moves that you shouldn't bounce if it will cause problems. I really like that. Hemalayaa is fun and engaging and even though I look like a klutz right now trying to dance, she makes me want to keep on trying. The only problem is that I wish she had a separate section where she shows each move a little slower so I can practice them more before the actual workouts. I definitely recommend this dvd to anyone who wants to have fun and laugh while trying to learn fun exercises.

I like the workout..but it was a bit fast for me..She is very motivating and excited...Just a personal preference. Hopefully I can work myself up to be able to keep up with her. I still think it is a great buy I just need to get myself there!!

This DVD is taught by Hemalayaa Behl, who appears along with two female background exercisers.  It actually offers four short workout segments (each less than 15 minutes in length) in addition to the warm-up and cool-down, thus allowing users to customize the total length of their workout time.  I have broken down each of these segments in greater detail below.

>WARM-UP (4 min).  Here Hemalayaa introduces the "walk," a move that replaces the basic march seen in many other workouts.  This is sort of a hip sway from side-to-side, and she uses it in place, moving forward, and moving back.  She also performs mini-plis and teaches the arm movements that are used throughout the workout.  Although Hemalayaa gives the Indian names for these exercises, she explains them by asking users to envision everyday movements--e.g., lightbulb arms, painting the walls, etc.
>WORKOUT 1 (5.5 min).  Hemalayaa calls this segment "Butt Monster Moves."  She returns to the mini-pli introduced in the warm-up but adds many different variations, including toe taps, side reaches, butt kicks, leg lifts, etc.
>WORKOUT 2 (8 min).  The first half of this workout includes a series of side-to-side lunge variations; Hemalayaa cues different arm movements (including "Indian vogue arms") and moves at a relatively quick pace.  The second half includes some plis as well as mini hops. Hemalayaa has you hop around so that you are facing away from the TV, and then you swivel just your head back over your shoulder while doing some fast hip flicks--this was a lot of fun!
>WORKOUT 3 (12 min).  This workout begins with the swan, a figure eight move with the hips.  Hemalayaa adds in a hip flick, going back and forth from side-to-side and constantly changing up the tempo.  However, because the swan and the hip flick were the only moves in this longer segment, it started to feel quite repetitive after awhile.
>WORKOUT 4 (11 min).  For this final section, Hemalayaa does not teach anything new; rather, she incorporates parts of each of the three prior workout segments above.
>COOL-DOWN (3.5 min).  Hemalayaa concludes the workout by leading fluid, yoga-like stretching.

Overall, Hemalayaa and her two female background exercisers really do seem to be enjoying themselves during this workout.  Although some of the moves WERE fun, I didn't find the workout to be very intense, and I didn't really find that it targeted my "booty" more than any other area.  This DVD is probably best suited for those looking for a very light, fun cardio workout--if you don't mind shaking your booty, Hemalayaa is likely to put a smile on your face.

I really like this DVD.  I usually hate working out, but I actually found myself enjoying this one.  Maybe not for hardcore fitness enthusiasts, but perfect for normal people.  None of that silly counting-out-loud banter that seems to be the norm.  She's funny, and personable.  Oh, and I have to say, I rarely sweat...at least the kind that runs down my forehead.  But I actually get very sweaty with this workout.

I have to say I'm usually willing to try " out of the ordinary" workout videos so I thought this one would be fun and the least abnoxious out of the bollywood series and boy was I wrong. This is not fun or enjoyable in anyway. It is extremley boring and repetative. It's like they just made up a routine as they went along. Do not be fooled! Save you money!

I did this workout a few times.  It is a good workout if you're a beginner to exercise...but if your already a frequent exerciser, this workout may be a little boring.

The workout is VERY repetitive...which is great because you feel it in your booty...but it also becomes tedious and dull doing the same moves over and over.

If you're a beginner, definitely try this.  If your looking for something with higher impact that offers more conditioning, definitely try her other bollywood workouts!

It was very frustrating trying to do a dance workout when the music and the moves are not in sync. They obviously taped the workout without music because their rhythm and tempo change constantly.  The music and instructions were dubbed over it and they did a terrible job.  I turned it off.

I love working out to the Bollywood Booty DVD. I recently read about it in Fitness magazine.  I have been to India and love the Bollywood movie dancing, so I thougth this would be a fun one.

And I was right!  The moves are so fun, you kind of forget you are getting an aerobic work out.  My friend's kids love to do it with me!

Put it on your home workout list.

I have to start by saying that Hemalayaa's workouts have changed my life. I hated every form of physical activity (except dancing) and had never found a video that I enjoyed and that provided results. I'm so glad I found Hemalayaa's DVDs because now I do one a day and I already feel beautiful and in much better shape. I even walk with more confidence, and I'm pretty sure my butt is rounder!

I already owned two Hemalayaa DVDs (Bollywood Burn and Beautiful Belly) and so my only decision was which one to try next. Bollywood Booty is, in my opinion, her best yet, for 1) how much fun the exercises are, 2) how sexy and varied the movements are, 3) how awesome the music is, and 4) the bonus dance Odissi in the special features.

Bollywood Booty is a lighter-weight workout than Beautiful Belly (which is the best for quick abdominal results). Hemalayaa is, as usual, joyful and the perfect instructor for those of us who don't like to take ourselves or our workout too seriously. You can't help but smile and feel great while doing a Hemalayaa video!

This is the second DVD I have from  Hemalayaa and it is alot of fun.  You smile as she teaches you the moves, her personality is contagious.

In this DVD she focuses on exercises for the backside/hips, with the additional arm and hand movements that really help to tone the arms and keep them enagaged, though the is not the target of the DVD.

Easy to follow and I the instruction was a bit more than on her other DVD, which I found a plus.  I was able to do the workouts though I am not very coordinated when it comes to these things.

Right now it is my new favorite of hers.

I love, love, love this workout.  It keeps you engaged and time just flies by.  I find that not only does this work your booty; but I feel the burn in my hips and obliques as I shimmy and shake.  It is also great because it is perfect workout out for a small space easily done in the living room without moving the furniture out of the way.

I am a big user of Hemalayaa's video workouts - and I think this one serves as a great warm-up. It helps you change it up when you can select the warm up and then choose which workout you want to do; then pop in another video (now I'm going to try her "beautiful belly" workout), depending on what you feel like (yoga, weight training). I recommend this as a great warm up video which is fun, and as always Hemalayaa is cool in this video like her others! *The only reason why I wouldnt give it five stars is because she has alot of knee-bending movements in some of the workouts which makes it hard for people like me to do all the moves. Otherwise cool video!

This is a great dance workout video.  Somehow I almost got two, one shipped to the wrong address, but it got fixed and I was only billed for one. I would HIGHLY recommend this video.  I do it every morning and it puts me in a good mood for the day.  It's not too hard, or too easy; a good workout.  And it's fun!

I saw Hemalayaa on a couple different talk shows last falls and she seemed to be fun and have lots of energy, so I figured I would order a couple of her DVDs. It's something fun and different.  My teen is really enjoying it too so that's a plus
I was having a lot of trouble getting back into an exercise routine, but this workout was so much fun and easy to follow that it hardly felt like exercise.

I had alot of fun with this one and came online to mention one thing that would be important to city-dwellers: this workout is tiny-apartment-friendly.  You can do the entire workout in in a 5'x5' space and the only thing I couldn't do for respect for my neighbors was the hopping which was quite minimal anyway.

After trying The Bollywood Dance Workout With Hemalayaa and finding it fun albeit inadequate with regard to its ability to raise my heart rate and sustain it at an injury-free level, I was reluctant to devote 45 minutes of my time to "Bollywood Booty" and be disappointed. Happily, I wasn't. Whether this DVD will reshape your backside as it promises, I do not doubt, but this depends upon the level of your fitness. Repeated movements of this sort cannot help but redefine your butt. However, Hemalayaa's derriere workout is limited to fast plies and side to side lunges that she incorporates to work within the pacing of a dance that she threads together in four separate segments that when played back to back equal the entire 45 minute program. Squats are mentioned on the back cover of the case, but other than a repetitive backwards motion where one's back is flat and the rear end is thrust out with exaggerated hip movements, I do not recall any of the classic move being incorporated. Hand and arm movements abound as well as full body undulations that Hemalayaa explains in exuberant voice-over as she stomps through the segments in happy abandon that one cannot fail to want to emulate. Caveat: Hemalayaa and her dance team do perform barefooted as I did. Simply don exercise footwear to prevent problems if your knees experience pain during jumping movements. Bollywood Booty is not billed as a cardio workout, therefore I did not expect to have an elevated heart rate throughout the routine. With that thinking put aside, I was able to enjoy the DVD for what it was worth--as an do-able and entertaining routine that introduces the participant to Bhangra dance. As I sashayed, tic-toked, jumped and elked my way through the routine with a big smile on my face, I realized that Bollywood Booty delivered the fun it advertised. Maybe I wasn't sweating, but I got my body moving and felt good for the rest of the day. In addition to the four individual "Booty" segments, Bollywood Booty includes bonus dance features that act as advertisements for other Acacia products. Dance and Be Fit: Brazilian Body looked particularly appealing to someone like myself who wants to feel a little more intensity while performing simpler moves within the framework of dance. Bottom line? If you are in reasonable fitness health, don't expect to be sweating profusely at the end of this 45 minute boot-ay sculpting session. If you are accustomed to performing repetitive squats, lunges and other butt building exercises, you may be a little disappointed in Hemalayaa's offering. Here, the moves fit together to enable the participant to perform a facsimile of a Punjabi dance (think the vibrantly happy dance fest in Monsoon Wedding or the train station stomp in Slumdog Millionaire) and relish the ebullient sensual feeling of moving sinuously with the beat rather than focus on slowly perfecting form. Recommended as a smile-cracking alternative to the usual larger moves utilized in other butt sculpting DVDs. Diana Faillace Von Behren "reneofc"

I had a lot of fun with this workout but yet I was getting a real burn. I like the fact that you can choose to do 1, 2 or all of the segments depending on your mood and time constraints. It is nice to know you can fit in a workout even if you only have 15 minutes. I also like the music only option + the bonus workout (slower yoga style). This was new and different and I think it will be easy to stick with. I liked it so much I bought all the other newer workouts as well. Highly recommend!
I really enjoyed this DVD, if its not a challenge for you, its certainly a good and very fun Warm up! I like this DVD as well as all of Hemalayaa's previous DVD's!

A bit on my background first - I do a minimum of 30 minutes of treadmill work 7 days a week, I weight train 5 days a week, I do some sort of fitness DVD two days a week, and I do yoga at least 3 days a week. So, I'm very active, healthy, and in good shape. I got this workout on a whim, based on a review that I had read elsewhere. I was looking for something different to do, other than my pilates and cardio/tone interval DVDs. I get bored easily, and need lots of change to keep my interest. I watched this one day while on the treadmill and did it the next morning before work. It was a lot of FUN. Not your regular excercise routine. It got me moving and doing SOMETHING, rather than starting my day with a trek on the treadmill - I saved that for later. It's very carefree and flowing. I laughed while doing it and had a good time before I had to head out the house. A great way to start the day. It's not going to give you muscules or firm you like a fitness model. It's simply going to get you moving and bring you heart rate up a bit. If you're looking for a good, fun time that is different from the rest of the workout DVDs, this is it. After doing this one and having such a good time, I ordered several other of Hemalayaa's DVDs, and I'm really looking forward to trying them out.
Just have fun with this. Let yourself go, dance like no one is watching, and enjoy yourself. Being fit isn't always about the strenous weight lifting and sweat drenching runs. It's about moving, having a good time, and keeping regular with whatever makes you feel good. This is good for keeping your workout routine well rounded and interesting.

I got this video yesterdan and had been feeling sick all week and was just beginning to get over the flu.  I woke up early (5:30) to see if I could workout before going in to work and decided to give this a try.  What fun!

I really enjoyed that I could choose which of the four workouts I wanted and that you can select the warmup and cool downs. I hate videos that let you choose individual sections of a workout without allowing you to select the warmup/cool downs.  I had a blast doing the workout and can tell that it immediately lifted my mood and energy level for the day.

I look forward to the weekend when I can go through the whole video.  Definitely a fun workout for the morning.

Hemalayaa has another well put together workout video with Bollywood Booty. The DVD is energetic and fun and works the core, legs, and booty very well. The music is engaging and upbeat which is wonderful for a workout video. There was a lot of thought put into the ambiance of the video that shows what a master dancer Hemalayaa is.
The Workout begins with a warm up that introduces you to the movements and the names of certain moves that you will be doing during the workout. Then the rest of the workout is broken down into segments which can be played all together or done seperately if you aren't ready for the whole thing. Each segment works in different combinations which are all fun and sassy. The Butt Monster Moves will have you sweating with a smile plastered across your face. I love the Elk moves! So sassy and playful.
Have you ever watched a workout video where all the people in it look bored or you can tell they are reminding themselves to smile? It looks forced and painful. This is NOT that DVD. Hema and her two dancers all look like they are truly enjoying themselves and dancing with one another. That is such a rare thing that my husband even pointed it out. I am not sure how you could refrain from smiling while doing the "Butt Monster Moves" but I have seen some DVDs where sour faced backup dancers could have.
This is a great workout for the core, hips, thighs, and of course the booty. Not only will your booty be lifted...your spirits will as well. We could all use a little laughter and good feeling as we work out. It makes you want to pop the DVD in and do it again. I highly recommend Hemalayaa's Bollywood Booty DVD for anyone who hates a boring workout.
This video is fun to workout to. My daughter who is 5 enjoys it to. It's something that we do together and have fun.

This DVD provides the most fun exercising possible. If you like music and dance you will love this series of exercise routines. Awaken the joy of movement and watch your attitude towards your body change!

I agree with the reviewer who said that a lot of the cueing & choreography are not performed with the rhythm of the music. This is mostly because Hemalayaa spends a lot of time telling you to 'play with the camera' instead of how to work the gluts! The 'butt monster' move,which was introduced in the beginning, was not challenging at all. In fact there are more torso exercises than those working the gluts. A lot of the glut action involves just plies, but Bollywood dance involves so much more than that. The last dance segment combined other dance segments with a slight variation instead of just creating a challenging dance sequence. By this time my body was bored, not tired. Thankfully there is a 5 1/2 minute segment of 'Brazilian Body' with Kimberly Mullen in the bonus features section. Now that really got the body going including the all important gluts!  Since then I've purchased that DVD which both challenging & enjoyable to practice. Therefore, I'll give Bollywood Booty an extra star for that extra segment of Brazilian Body.
great for all ages and fun
wasn't the lessons I thought it was

So much fun and playfulness tricks you into thinking this workout isn't a challenge!!! This has firmed my booty and my waist! Hemalaya is such a beautiful and encouraging dance instructor. This workout is fun and sexy!!!

WORTH THE LOW COST. Arrived Tuesday. I've used it Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday-purchased more of her workouts right away. My body feels it already. Intend to do the workout one week then switch to BELLY for a week then DANCE for the next week. One caveat-the BOLLYWOOD DANCE WORKOUT already contains the BOOTY so don't buy separately if you get the DANCE; [I'll gift the extra.] Fun and really makes you sweat a bit. I don't do the jumping but modify as she encourages. Seems my 20 pounds overweight will be a thing of the past very soon combined with my modified food plan.
Perfect workout for begginers! I love it!
lots of fun
Made for intermediate, not beginners.
This DVD rally does not help with workout. Its just okay.
Wife loves it
used once so far seems easy and effective, I was sweating within 10 minutes
